column2: Hey! You guys! You\xc2\x92re not gonna believe this! I just got off the\nphone with my agent\xc2\x85'
Oh my God! (Joey looks at her.) I\xc2\x92m sorry, too soon. You go.'
Okay. I got nominated for my part on Days of Our Lives!'
Joey!'
Good for you!'
Congratulations! Wow! I can\xc2\x92t believe you\xc2\x92re nominated for an Emmy!'
No-no.'
Oh Soap Opera Digest award!'
No! I\xc2\x92m up for a Soapie!'
Honey? Is that something you\xc2\x92re making up?'
No, no, no! It\xc2\x92s real! And it has been since 1998. (Rachel returns\nfrom the bathroom.) Hey Rach! Rach! I\xc2\x92m up for a Soapie!'
(gasps) Oh my God! Oh my God!! That is like the third most prestigious\nsoap opera award there is!'
Thank you! Well, I guess now I know who I\xc2\x92m taking to the awards.\n(Points to Rachel.)'
Oh, stop that! Don\xc2\x92t kid about that! (Gasps) Will all the stars be\nthere?'
Many are scheduled to appear.'
Oh my God! Oh my God! I can\xc2\x92t go! I\xc2\x92m gonna be too nervous!'
(to Joey) Okay, I\xc2\x92ll go!'
No!! You are getting married! This is all I have.'

\xc2\x85and it was Ernst Muhlbrat who first hypothesized that the\nVelociraptor would expand it\xc2\x92s collar and emit a high pitched noise to frighten\nit\xc2\x92s predator. (A student raises his hand.) Yes Mr. Lewis? '
What kinda noise?'
Just a high pitched intimidating noise.'
But like how?'

Well we-we don\xc2\x92t know for sure. But in my head it-it sounded
something like this. (He makes a high pitched noise and Alan doesn\xc2\x92t know what to
make of it.) Of course, this is just conjecture. Okay, that\xc2\x92s uh, that\xc2\x92s all for
today. (Everyone starts to get up.) Uh Mr. Morse, can I see you for a moment? '
Yes sir.'
Mr. Morse I need to talk to you about your mid-term exam, I\xc2\x92m afraid\nI-I had to fail you.'
(shocked) Why?!'
Well you need 60% to pass\xc2\x85'
What\xc2\x92d I get?'
Seven.'
That\xc2\x92s not so good.'
No-no it\xc2\x92s not. What-what happened there Ned?'
Well maybe you can cut me some slack. I\xc2\x92m sort of in love.'
Well I\xc2\x92m sorry but, that-that\xc2\x92s really not my problem.'
I\xc2\x92m in love with you.'
Well that brings me in the loop a little.'

You see, that\xc2\x92s why I did so bad on this test. I\xc2\x92m having a
hard time concentrating. When you\xc2\x92re up there (Points to the podium) and you\xc2\x92re
teaching and your face gets all serious\xc2\x85you look so good. (In a sexy voice) You wear
that tight little turtleneck sweater\xc2\x85'

Okay! (Walks away from him.) Umm, I uh, I\xc2\x92m your teacher. I\xc2\x92m\nsorry, you\xc2\x92re-you\xc2\x92re a student and I-and I like women. In spite of what may be\nwritten on the backs of some of these chairs.'
Oh my God! That guy at the counter is totally checking you out!'
Really? (Looks.) My God, he\xc2\x92s really cute.'
Go for it.'
Phoebe, I\xc2\x92m engaged!'

I\xc2\x92m just saying, get his number just in case. But no Chandler is in\nan accident and can\xc2\x92t perform sexually and he would want you to take a lover to\nsatisfy the needs that he can no longer fulfill.'
Op, can I just tell you something? Very flattered but umm, I\xc2\x92m\nengaged. (Points to her ring.)'
Well you should be embarrassed. (Leaves.)'
I did, but that was really fun.'

(pretending to be an announcer) And the winner is\xc2\x85Joey Tribbiani! (He
then gets excited and goes over to the counter to practice his acceptance speech using a
bottle of maple syrup as the award.) Oh\xc2\x85 Wow! I honestly never expected this. I uh, I
didn\xc2\x92t prepare a speech. But umm, I\xc2\x92d like to thank (Rachel enters quietly) my
parents, who\xc2\x92ve always been there for me. I\xc2\x92d also like to thank my friends,
Chandler, Monica, Phoebe, Rachel\xc2\x85'
I\xc2\x92m fourth! (Joey is startled.) Look at you with your little maple\nsyrup award!'
Yeah may-maybe you don\xc2\x92t tell anyone about this.'
What? No! It\xc2\x92s not a big deal! I do that too, with my shampoo\nbottle.'
Really?'
Yeah.'
What award are you practicing for?'
Grammy, Best New Artist.'
Oh, hey listen! The Soapie\xc2\x92s called today and I also get to present\nan award.'
Ohh that\xc2\x92s great!'
Yeah!'
So you\xc2\x92ll definitely get onstage, even if you don\xc2\x92t win.'
(confused) What you-you don\xc2\x92t think I\xc2\x92m gonna win?'
Well of course I do! But y\xc2\x92know, favorite returning character is a\ntough category Joey. I mean you\xc2\x92re up against the guy who survived his own cremation.'
Yeah. No-no I-I know I might not win, but it\xc2\x92s just\xc2\x85I\xc2\x92ve\nnever even been nominated before! I want it so much.'

Well Joey, you\xc2\x92ll probably get it. But you should probably
your-your gracious loser face. Y\xc2\x92know when like the cameras are on you and you wanna
look disappointed but also that your colleague deserved to win. Y\xc2\x92know? So it\xc2\x92s
sorta like\xc2\x85 (Does it, you\xc2\x92ll have to see it.)'
Hey! (Likes it.)'
Y\xc2\x92know?'
You practice losing the Grammies too?'
Oh no, at the Grammies I always win.'
Ah.'
Oh hey!'
Hey! How\xc2\x92d your date go with Jake?'

Oh, great! We couldn\xc2\x92t keep our eyes off each other all night and\nthen every once and a while y\xc2\x92know, he\xc2\x92d kinda lean over and stroke my hair and\ntouch my neck. (Does that to Monica.)'
Okay, stop it Phoebe, you\xc2\x92re getting me all tingly.'
(laughs) All I could think of was y\xc2\x92know, "Is he gonna kiss\nme? Is he gonna kiss me?"'
And did he?'
I\xc2\x92m a lady Monica, I don\xc2\x92t kiss and tell. But this hickey\nspeaks for itself. (She starts to open up her blouse.)'
Okay-okay, I got it. I got it.'
I just like him so much that I just feel like I\xc2\x92ve had 10 drinks\ntoday and I\xc2\x92ve only had six.'
Oh, I haven\xc2\x92t had that feeling since I first started going out with\nChandler. Wow, I\xc2\x92m never gonna have that feeling again am I?'
You sound like a guy.'

No, a guy would be saying, "I\xc2\x92m never gonna get to sleep with
anyone else." Oh my God! I\xc2\x92m never gonna get to sleep with anyone else!
I\xc2\x92ve been so busy planning the wedding that I forgot about all the things that
I\xc2\x92d be giving up! I mean, I\xc2\x85I\xc2\x92m never gonna have a first kiss again.'
You\xc2\x92ll have a last kiss.'
Can I ask you something? Have you ever had a guy have a crush on you?'
Is that why you wanted to tie my tie?'
There\xc2\x92s this kid in my class who said he\xc2\x92s in love with me.'
Whoa!'
(entering from her room) Whoa what?'
Ross has a boyfriend.'
I do-I do not have a boyfriend. There\xc2\x92s a guy in one of my\nclasses who-who has a crush on me.'
Really?'
Yeah! I don\xc2\x92t know. I mean, last year Elizabeth now-now this kid.\nWhat-what-what-what is it?! Am I giving out some kind of\xc2\x85sexy professor vibe? (Rachel\nand Joey both look at him.)'
Not right now.'
It-it\xc2\x97The point is my natural charisma has made him fail his midterm.'

Oh, see now I feel bad for the kid! I had a crush on a teacher once and
it was so hard! Y\xc2\x92know you\xc2\x97I couldn\xc2\x92t concentrate and I blushed every time
he looked at me. I mean come on, you remember what\xc2\x92s it\xc2\x92s like to be 19 and in
love.'
Yeah. I guess I can cut him some slack.'
Yeah.'
How\xc2\x92d you get over that teacher?'
I didn\xc2\x92t. I got under him.'
(To Ross) Problem solved.'
Bye Phoebe.'
Okay bye. (They kiss.)'
All right. Bye. (Backs out the door.)'
Bye! (Phoebe goes over and joins Monica on the couch.) We said good-bye\nat the door so as not to flaunt our new love.'

Phoebe, it\xc2\x92s okay. You don\xc2\x92t have to tip toe around me.\nI-I\xc2\x92ve been thinking about it and umm, y\xc2\x92know what? I\xc2\x92m okay about not\nhaving that new relationship feeling\xc2\x85'
(yelling through the window to Phoebe) I miss you already!!'
(yelling back) I miss you too!!!! (He walks away.)'

See? That\xc2\x92s what I mean. I mean that, that\xc2\x92s great! But
I wouldn\xc2\x92t trade in what I have for that. I mean I\xc2\x92m gonna be with Chandler for
the rest of my life, and that\xc2\x92s what makes me happy. (Chandler approaches.) Hey
sweetie, come here! Come sit down. Hey Phoebe and I were just talking about how our
relationship is deep and meaningful. It really is don\xc2\x92t you think?'
Oh totally! (Holds up his finger.) Pull my finger.'
(To Rachel) This is it! This is my category.'
I know! My God! Do you have your speech?'
Yeah, I got my speech!'
Do you got your gracious loser face?'
Yeah. (Does it.)'
Now Joey remember, if you win you have to hug me! You hug me!'
Okay. Can I squeeze your ass?'
On TV?! Yeah!'
\xc2\x91Kay! '
\xc2\x85in the category of Favorite Returning Male Character the\nnominees are

What the?! (Joey pounds the table and starts yelling at Rachel, and which\nis drowned out by applause. Rachel is desperately trying to tell Joey that he\xc2\x92s on TV\nright now. He finally notices and he does his gracious loser face.)'

(angrily and monotone) Any one of the brilliant actresses nominated for
this award tonight deserves to take it home. Unfortunately only one can. (Shakes his head
in disgust.) The nominees for Best Supporting Actress are from Passions Erin Goff.
(There is applause, which Joey disgustedly waits to dye out.) From One Life to Live
Mary Loren Bishop (They start to applaud again, but Joey interrupts in with the rest of
the nominees), from All My Children Sarah Mchann, and from Days of Our Lives
Jessica Ashley. And the winner is\xc2\x85(Opens the envelope)\xc2\x85Jessica Ashley from Days
of Our Lives. (Applause) Uh, unfortunately Jessica couldn\xc2\x92t be with us tonight so
I\xc2\x92ll be accepting this award on her behalf. (Realizes something) And I\xc2\x92m sure
that Jessica would like to thank my parents who always believed in me. She\xc2\x92d also
like to thank my friends, Chandler, Monica, Ross, Phoebe, and Rachel who\xc2\x92s
sittin\xc2\x92 right there! (Points at Rachel.) (The music starts and his microphone is
turned off, this angers Joey again and he disgustedly exits.)'
Joey! Why did we have to rush out of there so fast?!'
Rach we had to get out of there because, look what I won! (He whips out\nthe award for Best Supporting Actress that he accepted for Jessica.)'
Oh my God you stole her award!'
No-no! No, I\xc2\x92m accepting it on her behalf. (He puts it up above the\nTV to display it.)'
Joey I don\xc2\x92t think you know what behalf means.'
Sure I do! It\xc2\x92s a verb! As in, "I behalfin\xc2\x92 it!"'
Joey, you have got to take this back!'
But why?! I should\xc2\x92ve won one and I really want it and she\ndidn\xc2\x92t even care enough to come to the thing! It could also be a Grammy.'
(looking at the award) No! Joey!'
Come on Rach! No one saw me take it! There was a whole table full of\n\xc2\x91em.'
Do you really want an award you didn\xc2\x92t win?'

No! I want an award I did win! But nobody\xc2\x92s giving me any of those!\nPlus\xc2\x97Hey Rach, if-if I put it up there (Points to the TV) right? When people come\nover they\xc2\x92ll see it and they\xc2\x92ll think I won it.'
Joey is says Best Supporting Actress!'
I can scratch that right off.'

Joey no, this is wrong! You have to take it back, okay? You don\xc2\x92t\nwant to win an award this way. You\xc2\x92re very talented. And someday you\xc2\x92re gonna\nwin one of these for real and that one is gonna mean something.'
All right!'
All right? (He sets the award down.) Thank you.'
I\xc2\x92ll take it back tomorrow.'
Thank you.'
(opening his door) If I can\xc2\x92t have it you can\xc2\x92t have it! (Rachel\nwalks away angrily.)'
Professor Geller?'
(turning towards him) Yes Mr. Lewis, how can I help you?'
I know I didn\xc2\x92t do well on my midterms and stuff but, I was kinda\nhoping you could change my grade.'
And why exactly would I do that? (Goes back to writing on the board.)'
Because I\xc2\x92m in love with you.'
(turning around and dragging the chalk down the board) What?!'
Yeah, I\xc2\x92m all\xc2\x85in love with you and stuff. So could you change\nmy grade?'
No!'
Well why not you changed Ned\xc2\x92s grade!'
Well that\xc2\x92s different! Okay? Because he, he was actually in love with\nme!'
No he\xc2\x92s not! He\xc2\x92s totally yanking your chain! He\xc2\x92s done\nthis with three other teachers!'
What?'
He\xc2\x92s got a girlfriend!'
I can\xc2\x92t believe someone would do that for a grade.'
I know! It\xc2\x92s awful. I love you.'
Have you seen Chandler?'
No. Why?'
\xc2\x91Cause I just keeping thinking about all these things that I\xc2\x92m\nnot gonna have and it\xc2\x92s freaking me out. I don\xc2\x92t know what to do about it.'
Okay, don\xc2\x92t sweat it. (Looking around her.) Chandler is nowhere\naround so go ahead get it out of your system. That guy\xc2\x92s cute. (Points to a guy\nsitting behind Monica.)'
Phoebe! Come on I\xc2\x92m serious! I just got to talk to him about all\nthis.'
No that is the last thing you want to do!'
Why?'
Because you\xc2\x92re marrying him!'
You gotta help me out here Pheebs.'

All right, I\xc2\x92ve never been engaged and I\xc2\x92ve never really been\nmarried, but I can only tell you what my mother told me. Whenever you have doubts or fears\nor anxieties about a relationship, do not communicate them to your husband.'
So I\xc2\x92m not supposed to share my doubts and fears with the guy\nI\xc2\x92m gonna spend the rest of my life with?'
That is correct! Yes, you\xc2\x92re supposed to take all of that stuff and\nput it in a little box in your mind and then lock it up tight.'
Your mother told you this?'
Yes!'
The woman that got married a bunch of times and killed herself when you\nwere 13?'

Oh my God! You\xc2\x92re right! Go! (Monica starts to leave.) Go tell\nChandler! Hurry before it\xc2\x92s too late! Wait no! (Monica stops.) Does this also mean\nputting out doesn\xc2\x92t get you love? (Monica is shocked.)'
I cannot believe I\xc2\x92m gonna meet Jessica Ashley!'
Okay wait-wait p-please be cool! Okay? I work with this woman.'
Okay, I\xc2\x92m totally cool! (She coolly knocks on the door)'
Come in.'
Hey Jessica.'
(coolly) Hey Jess.'
Ah, this is my friend Rachel.'
Hi.'
\xc2\x91Sup? (Joey glares at her.)'
Uh listen, here\xc2\x92s your Soapie. I accepted it for ya. (Hands it to\nher.)'
(shocked) Oh my God! I won! Do you have any idea what this\nmeans?! (She rolls her eyes and throws it onto the couch.)'
Well, that-that-that\xc2\x92s it? You\xc2\x92re gonna, you\xc2\x92re gonna put\nit on your self or anything?'
No, I try to save that for real awards. Now, if you\xc2\x92ll\nexcuse me. (She exits.)'
(To Rachel) Take it back?'
Absolutely.'
Y-y-yeah! (As they start to leave, Rachel pauses and steals a vase with\nflowers in it.) Yeah you do. (They exit.)'
Honey, as we get closer to the wedding, is there anything that you would\nlike to talk about or share?'
Okay. Well, I think the centerpieces are too big'
You\xc2\x92re wrong! The centerpieces are fine! Do you ever get scared at\nall?'
Kinda. They\xc2\x92re really big.'
Doesn\xc2\x92t it ever just freak you out that-that you\xc2\x92re never\ngonna be with anybody new again?'
What?'

Just, I love you so much. Just\xc2\x85It\xc2\x92s just sometimes it bothers\nme that I\xc2\x92m never gonna have that feeling. Y\xc2\x92know when you meet someone for the\nfirst time and it\xc2\x92s new and exciting? Y\xc2\x92know that rush?'
No. No, see when I first meet somebody it\xc2\x92s uh it\xc2\x92s mostly\npanic, anxiety, and a great deal of sweating.'
Okay, but all right you\xc2\x92re a guy, does it not freak you that\nyou\xc2\x92re never gonna sleep with anybody else?'
Sleeping with somebody new, anxiety, panic, and I\xc2\x92m afraid even\nmore sweating.'
Even with me?'
I was dangerously dehydrated during the first six months of our\nrelationship. (Monica laughs.) Look, for me the rush is knowing that we are gonna be\ntogether for the rest of our lives.'
Really?'
Well yeah! But now that I know that you\xc2\x92re having these thoughts,\nI\xc2\x92m back to panic, anxiety, and uh I\xc2\x92m definitely gonna need some kind of sports\ndrink.'

Come here! Come here! (They hug.) Sweetie you don\xc2\x92t have to worry.\nNo, besides y\xc2\x92know what? I\xc2\x92m gonna have a lot of new things with you. The first\ntime we buy a house. Our first kid. Our first grandkid\xc2\x85'
(hoarsely) Water! Water! Water!'
Uh Mr. Morse, can I speak to you for a moment?'
(walking up) That was a great lecture today. Did you get a little hair\ncut?'
Uh-hmm, yeah-yeah do you like it? Do-do you looove it? I just want you to\nknow that I\xc2\x92m changing your grade back.'
What?! Why?'
\xc2\x91Cause I know what you\xc2\x92re trying to pull here. Okay? It\xc2\x92s\nnot gonna work.'
I\xc2\x92m not trying to pull anything. Look I love you dude.'

Y\xc2\x92know what? I-I\xc2\x92m not even gonna talk about this. Okay? This
little thing is over. I know you have a girlfriend! Okay\xc2\x97(Ned looks
shocked)\xc2\x97Yeah! And I know about the other professors! How do you think that makes me
feel Ned?! You used me! You don\xc2\x92t love me and you never did! (Ross turns around to
make a grand exit but runs into two colleagues.) Ah Professor Winston, Professor
Fredrickson, I\xc2\x92ll be right with you. (To Ned) Don\xc2\x92t make this worse and
I\xc2\x92ll give you a C. (To the professors) Shall we? (They leave.)'
Rach? '
I\xc2\x92ll be out in a second.'

Oh. (Picks it up.) It\xc2\x92s just so unexpected! I\xc2\x85I uh\xc2\x85Boy
I\xc2\x92ll tell you it\xc2\x92s just such an honor to be nominated for a Nobel Prize
and y\xc2\x92know to win one for a massage. Especially after having just won a Tony
award for best actress in\xc2\x85'
(entering from her room) Honey, we have to go. Our reservations are at\n8
\xc2\x85in Reservations at 8
Okay honey, you can finish this later we\xc2\x92re gonna be late. We gotta\ngo.'
Please, don\xc2\x92t play the music. Just uh one more. LIVE FROM NEW\nYORK! IT\xc2\x92S SATURDAY NIGHT!!'
